Reviews.Title: “Not a place if you want to actually sleep....”
Reviews.Author: Dawn D
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice enough....but, every morning for 6 days, the maids came through and played music, slammed doors, yelled "housekeeping". Just super annoying before 9 am....even on weekends. Not a quiet hotel and walls/ ceilings/floors super thin. Recommend the location, but if you plan on actually sleeping at all during your stay, go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheFab75
Reviews.Content: JL 76 is a very nice boutique hotel (approx. 50 rooms) in the museum district of Amsterdam, therefore not in the busy center, but not far (walking distance or tramway). The only problem we had was that the room that was given to us in the first place was basically ..in the basement. Therefore : only a small window at the ground level, with no view, impossible to see the sky. We were very unhappy and asked to have another room. The staff felt sorry for us, but couldn't do anything as the hotel was fully booked. However, the promised to give us another room the day after for our 2nd night. We just had to pack our luggage and leave it in the room in the morning, it would be transferred by them to our new room. Which was done: we had a room on the highest floor and even had a free bottle of white wine with a handwritten apology note. For me, service is the most precious point in luxury, and the way they dealt with all this was perfect. Otherwise, the hotel is very nicely decorated, the bed is comfortable, the bathrooms are nice, the breakfast is very good (buffet + possibility to order a lot of other meals for free). I just think that no hotel of that level and price should have rooms in at the -1 level... that's why my mark is 4/5 and not 5. Many thanks to the staff if they read this note !

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Everything you need”
Reviews.Author: Phil_S_Los_Altos
Reviews.Content: I spend a very enjoyable 7 days at the JL 76 in early March. I was immediately impressed with the decor and the modern conveniences of this remodeled old building. Very cool. I booked an Executive Room (as it was all that was available). It had everything I needed for my week stay. The room I was given was on floor 2 and faced the back of the hotel. It was very quiet and I never heard another guest during my entire stay, although I know the hotel was quite booked. The bed and bedding were exceptionally clean and comfortable. The bathroom had a fantastic overhead rain shower head that really felt great. I found everything I needed as both a business traveler and a vacationer. In room safe, coffee maker, two tv's, great wifi internet. It should noted that the staff at the JL 76 is extremely friendly and helpful. Anytime I had questions or required assistance. The front desk was more like a concierge desk. Outstanding! Two other fantastic options with this hotel. First the honor bar. It is a small area that let's you come in and relax with a drink anytime. This was incredibly convenient with the odd hours I was keeping during this trip. This was a major plus. Also, the small restaurant made the most incredible pancakes (and other items) in the morning. Lots of different options, my favorite were the banana pancakes! The food was top notch. I didn't try for any other meals but ate a wonderful breakfast here every morning I stayed. Look for packages that include breakfast for additional savings. Overall, I'm going back to the JL 76. In fact, I have a trip booked next month (April) and I'm staying another week at this fantastic home away from home in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: greggles16
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at this easily accesible hotel. If you like small intimate & out of the hustle but within easy walking distance of all attractions this is for you.Used Avios points which made this very affordable with excellent breakfasts. Bus no 197 takes you close to the hotel from the airport & @ 8euros for 2 is far cheaper than the hotel shuttle bus or a taxi just ask @ info desk @ Schipnol they are very helpful. Beds are extremely comfortable & although room 102 was small it was very functional with flat screen TV ,Nespresso coffee & selection of premium tea Vondel park & Van Gogh museum on the door step together with designer shops.Staff very helpful if you need any info or refills for room

Reviews.Title: “terrible”
Reviews.Author: Cihat173
Reviews.Content: 1- I request to stay in good view room but my room was at -1 floor!!! and no view!!! 2- I made my reservation early but when i check out hotel tries to take regular price which is 40 euro different than my reservation!!! 3- We want to rent hotel bike; first day we asked price to the reception boy and decided to postpone. second day we still want to try and asked the price again but it was %50 above than the previous day!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in quiet area of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Jo H
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel via i-escapes website and liked the look of it as was near museums and good transport links back into main central part of Amsterdam. The room was lovely - with a view out to the street, tv in bathroom, comfortable bed.. couldn't fault it. Service was very friendly and helpful and the breakfasts were great with lots of different options to have. The hotel was modern but comfortable and very good value. We really enjoyed our stay and will definitely stay in the same hotel next time we visit - we only had a short trip of 2 nights booked, but keen to go back sooner rather than later. Highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LynneB446
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 days at this hotel and found it to be very comfortable, breakfast was excellant, and staff were very friendly and helpful. We would recommend this Hotel to everyone, as it is clost to everything and near to bus stops and tram stopes.

Reviews.Title: “Bit of a shock!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah433
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I've ever written a review because I have one important point to pass on. We were very excited about staying here considering the reviews and I'm sure it is a lovely hotel but when we arrived, we were told "there is good news", oh wonderful you think. No, even though we had booked last year with e-mail confirmation of our booking at JLNo76 two days before check in, when we arrived we were told the hotel was fully booked and had no room for us - what a lovely Birthday treat! We waited for a taxi and were sent to another Vondel hotel (Roemer), which although lovely rooms, lacked the same finish in the reception area, bags were not carried to the room and seemed a little unwelcoming. In the end things worked out ok but this is not acceptable when spending this amount of money. What made us chuckle was as we were leaving, we heard the same line from a receptionist at Roemer "we have some bad news and some good news"... of course they were off to a "sister hotel". So, the actual stay was pleasant with lovely rooms and bathrooms but be aware that when you book, either directly or through a booking agency, you may not be staying where you think.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely comfortable, great location, direct bus from airport”
Reviews.Author: Jose096
Reviews.Content: Comfort: I stayed at a 4th floor room, which was extremely comfortable and quiet. The use of space is amazing, the bed was excellent. Nespresso machine in rooom with courtesy coffee and tea. Free wi-fi internet. Staff was very kind and eager to help discoveingr Amsterdam. Breakfast was very good although a bit expensive. A small hotel with not much of common space, but with everything we needed for a nice stay. Location: It is at 5 min walking distance from Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh Museum, and Concertgebouw. The city center is just at 20 min walking distance. Bus 197 goes directly from Schiphol airport to the hotel (35min ride, bus stop at Hobbemastraat near the Rijksmuseum is perfect). Good restaurants in the nearby were "L'entrecÃ´te et les dames" and Pantry.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bhupendraa
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with the interesting name ..JL No 76, and was thrilled to have found it more interesting than I had thought. The hotel close to several important tourist places and also the nearby markets. The tram service to city centre is at a walking distance. The hotel does not have big rooms but it is cosy and clean with nice beds and descent bathroom with lcd TV and Jacuzzi. Complimentary Wi-Fi has good speed and stability. Reception staff is very nice and helpful. One of the best business hotels in budget category in Amsterdam. Certainly I will still again whenever in this hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: CXsjr
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in an upmarket residential area, within easy walking distance of several areas of interest, many of the museums, a multitude of restaurants and the 'designer' shopping area. Transport is within easy reach with tram stops for different lines at either end of the street. We arrived at the hotel mid-afternoon to be told we had been allocated an executive room in the basement. We asked if there was any chance of a move to an upper floor but unfortunately, the hotel was fully booked. Having read some of the other reviews, we were somewhat concerned that it would be noisy in the basement, however, the only thing we actually found to be a slight downside was the subterranean style windows which, being the middle of a particularly grey winter spell, did not allow a huge amount of natural light into the room. On our way back out of the hotel later that afternoon, we asked if there was any chance of a move to another room the following night and the extremely helpful young chap behind the desk quickly obliged in allocating us a room on the top floor for the following evening. The move went without hitch and the new room had a huge panoramic window spanning the whole width affording us great views across the rooftops of the city. Both rooms were tastefully decorated and as some reviews have mentioned, the beds were extremely comfortable. The bathrooms (exec rooms) were modern with jacuzzi baths, rain shower, and television! We did not make use of the honesty bar facilities nor did we take breakfast as we preferred to try out some of the many eateries and bars around the nearby canals. This hotel provided a great base for our short stay and will be our definite choice when we return in the summer!

Reviews.Title: “JL no76 is the best!”
Reviews.Author: Golowe
Reviews.Content: The hotel JL no76 was awesome it had 3 televisions one was in the bathroom so you can watch the tv in the bath.my mum and dad say the bed they slept in was the most comfortable bed they've ever slept in and the service was great. But our taxi driver was confused by the name. Overall it was awesome we loved it .From Joske a (12 yr old reviewer)!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: elizabeth h
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for five nights the week before Christmas, in room 100. Our room was beautiful, light and roomy, quiet. Extremely comfortable bed, IMHO. The staff couldn't have been nicer/more helpful. We had breakfast every day, yum. Good coffee too. Fantastic location, we walked everywhere all week. Love Amsterdam, love this hotel, and we WILL be back! Thanks for an awesome stay.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: Good location - right by the Van Gogh and Rijsmuseum. Trams and buses to city centre and airport are similarly close. Rooms spacious and comfortable. Bed was very nice. Coffee facilities were great, there was a nespresso machine in the room! TV in bathroom was a nice touch. Free wifi is reasonably fast. No parking available. Bit noisy in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel in Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: Lars A
Reviews.Content: Smooth and fast check-in, friendly and polite staff. We got a room in the basement, which was extremely noisy. It was right next to a staircase, a toilet and in the same hallway as the houskeeping staff had their equipment and washing machines. As a result, there was noise at all hours of the day. Impossible to sleep. Complained about the room and got a new one at the second floor which was great (including complimentary bottle of red wine). In a nice neighborhood surrounded by luxury store. Within walking distance to city centre. Recommended if you get a room above street level.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room with HUGE furniture in great location”
Reviews.Author: flowerchat1
Reviews.Content: Lovely location. 5min walk to Rijk and concertgebow. Room was very small (I thought that I'd booked the 30 sqm room, it was too late when I checked in and didn't want to bother an argument with the front desk at 1am) and stupidly designed considering the size. Two big arm chairs, anyone?Hello? And what's with the shiny curtains and brown color scheme? First of all I wanted to throw one of the chairs out of the window so there was some space for luggage. Sink doesn't fit in the bathroom, so it is at the entrance. The bathroom has a spa bath and a tv, but the water resistant remote for tv doesn't work, I hope they've noticed it by now. Bed is comfortable and there was an overall feeling of privacy, up in the top floor cramped with all the furniture. It's a shame because this hotel could really be very cosy and homey with few little updates.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic hotel in beautiful Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Rachiecakes
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful lovely hotel. We stayed for 4 nights the week before Christmas and Amsterdam was beautiful. The hotel is situated in a quiet road with excellent access to the Rijksmuseum (2min walk) and an easy walk to Leidsplein (in fact we walked everywhere in Amsterdam - fabulous location). It is away from all the hussle and bussle (no groups of lads or loud music/clubs) and it is very very romantic. The rooms are beautiful. We had the most gorgeous jacuzzi bath (perfect after a long day walking around Amsterdam), new towels every day (by the end of the week we had 10 towels in the room!) Lovely coffee machine and posh tea. The bed was so comfortable and the rooms were a nice size. A big thank you to the staff at the hotel. We had a few problems in the UK and they really helped out with phonecalls and their kindness. Rooms were kept immaculate. A lovely romantic hotel for those who want to enjoy the wonderful beautiful and cultural side of this incredible city. Highly highly recommended. Many thanks xx

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: europe21
Reviews.Content: We were orginally booked in JL No76's sister hotel Hotel Vondel but due to there being a spare room they asked if we wanted to try it out as it was new. We stayed in the an Executive Room which was great. It had a giant king bed, plasma tv, jucuzzi bath with its own tv at the foot of the bath and a nespresso machine. The breakfast that was included was great, it had the old favourite of bacon and eggs and cereal as well as the more european ham and cheeses. Good location and close to a few trams into the centre of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, staff were great, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Tammytams10
Reviews.Content: We arrived midweek for a three night stay. The hotel is indeed a perfect 'boutique' hotel. The soft furnishings are very glam and every communal area is imaculate. Our room wasn't huge but just perfect for the two of us. We had an incredible jucuzzi bath, a nespresso machine, two tvs (good channel choice) and the most comfortable HUGE bed with wonderful pillows! The staff couldn't have been more wonderful..from hiring bikes, to booking restaurants and giving the best 'off the beaten track' info about the city. All in all a wonderful stay, would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Arty and modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: KayKay83
Reviews.Content: This hotel is set behind the a high end shopping district and is surrounded by museums, arty eateries and easy tram access. The hotel is easy to get to from Schipol using the 197 bus that takes you to the front door (50yrs away) in 15mins The rooms are well designed with comfy beds, large tv and modern bathrooms including a bath tv and a nespresso coffee machine! I didn't eat at the hotel but made use of the honesty bar that was priced slightly different to the form you fill in. I also hired bikes from the hotel to explore the best of Amsterdam and would recommend this to other guests, the bikes are very good, well maintained and are at a very comparable price to other rentals.

Reviews.Title: “domestic bliss in tree lined quarter”
Reviews.Author: colm1234
Reviews.Content: The location is unbeatable on a beautiful treelined quiet street. Two minutes walk to the Van Gogh and Rijks galleries. My room was very comfortable. Nespresso machine, tv over the bath, etc The hotel is small and there are very few staff so if you wished to be greeted every few minututes by liveried staff this is not the place for you. The hotel seems to have been converted from two 19th century apartment blocks but it retains old world charm. Do rent a bike either from the hotel or from Mike's Bike's.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsM3810
Reviews.Content: Romantic stay here with my husband. Great hotel, but room a bit small, breakfast wasn't great as they neglected to show us a menu, and we never saw anyone the whole time we were eating, so we were unaware we could order hot food til our second day. Also, our bed was 2 singles pushed together. But nice hotel, decent staff and the bath with a tv is great! location was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting arty hotel .Amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: holyisle
Reviews.Content: First impressions were great,interesting art , warm feelingand very friendly helpful staff. We were a little alarmed to have a ground floor room beside the lift but in fact we never heard the lift though occasionally other guests were a bit noisy. No traffic noise at the back though. Space was a little tight in the room though this is generally the case in Amsterdam hotels but it had everything you would want and was very clean. Nice decor. Breakfast was excellent one day with lovely fruit salad and delicious little croissant though the next day we were disappointed both to find only 2 tired apples as the fresh fruit and definitely inferior croissant. Good selection which can be ordered from the menu as well as the buffet. Nice dining area. The standout thing about this hotel is the staff. Helpful, humorous and they really do the extra mile to assist. Travel tip. Don't order the airport shuttle! Didn't turn up after 50 mins and innumerable calls from the desk.The train is excellent but if you have heavy luggage take a taxi. Came within minutes and only cost a few Euros more than the shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “New Amsterdam address”
Reviews.Author: ahmadsameh
Reviews.Content: I just spent two nights at this new hotel. I am a regular client of Vondel Hotels and was pleasantly surprised by this third property. Location is GREAT , near enough to all the action but away from the hordes of tourists and backpackers. The rooms are clean, beds very comfortable although some aspects of the room were a bit quirky. Overall I enjoyed my stay and would be coming back for sure. I like ALL the Vondel hotels and thus it's hard to choose a favorite among the three.

Reviews.Title: “-1 ... down in the basement”
Reviews.Author: Suessmaul
Reviews.Content: THE area to be in: museum and fancy shopping district, yet quiet and with a real neighborhood feel. Arriving at the hotel I thought 'great, that was the right choice'. Nice building, homey feel good bar area and a friendly welcome. But bad luck, my room was in the basement. -1. Or a room with a special view: legs of passers by. Despite being a shoe fetichist I didn't enjoy this, feeling locked away. In addition it was a bit noisy due to the door of the public? loos right across the corridor. Certainly a very nice hotel, but make sure you get a room on the upper floors. For one night, arriving late and leaving early, I survived, but had I been there for a weekend and some time off, I would have been seriously annoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: epicedu
Reviews.Content: Great location, within walking distance from main spots. Totally quiet area. Not big but cozy and very comfortable room with very large windows. Beds cold be stiffer. Quiet hotel could almost hear no noise at night which is quite a valuable factor in Amsterdam... Friendly staff, with a special mention to Andre. Prices varied along the four days ranging from affordable 125â‚¬ to overpriced 220â‚¬... Will certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel? Not quite. And too expensive.”
Reviews.Author: spartac
Reviews.Content: This was the last hotel of our 3 week and some vacation in Europe. I wanted it to end on a high note, so I took the best room category available (room 201) in this ``Boutique Hotel``. Disappointment. I am not sure when this hotel opened but it doesn't seem to be a fully oiled machine. For example, on check in, the front desk person seems more interested in getting us processed than anything else (and there was no line up). No info on hotel, what's included or not (I had to ask). No map. She gave us only one key, I had to ask for a second. One other time I asked the person at the reception what was the best way to get to the Airport he had no clue. Eventually another member of the staff helped but I would expect even a junior person to be able to help (or find) this basic info. The room: was clearly made to look design hotel. But I had quite a few issues with it. First: it wasn't small as such but all the furniture was suffocating the room. We had one armchair too many. One would have been a lot better, instead of the second one blocking access to the balcony. The room didn't have any airy (let's not even talk minimalistic) feel. And speaking of balcony: quite uninviting. Wooden camping-like small chairs. The bathroom was the perfect example of ```smells like a boutique hotel, but isn't one``. The shower looked neat, with an interesting only half door covering the shower. Interesting. Until you start taking the shower and the water gets in the bathroom. There is no slope so it just stays there until you wipe it. Worse: there was no tablet to put the soap and the shampoo. There was a metallic arm sticking out of the wall, so I thought they were supposed to have those two in one soap/shampoo bottles and just forgot to put one. But it wasn't put on day two wither. So you really had to put all the things you need either on the floor or on the bath, one meter away. It really made no sense! And next to this you had an awesome feature like TV on the wall of the bathtub. Neat but honestly I would have preferred that they make the room functional instead of adding features. Bed? Real King size for once, rare in Europe. But only so so comfort. And the linens felt really cheap. It was too expensive. I paid an average of 195 Euro per night (One night at 150 euro and the other at 24o euro!) , no including breakfast. The area is quiet, but having stayed twice in the Museum neighborhood, I can tell you that it's a bit far off from most everything and a solid 40 min walk to the interesting areas, once you're done with the museums. Not a whole lot of interesting eateries or cafÃ©s around. All in all: Not all bad, beautiful hotel, but I don't recommend the place, and certainly won't return.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: tervol1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel JL No76 for 4 nights. We liked the hotel's location in the museum district. From Schiphol airport you can take the number 197 bus which stops just 2 blocks from the hotel. We found this easier than taking the train to Amsterdam Centraal and changing to tram from there. Getting from the hotel to the centre is a nice 10 minute walk or just a few minutes tram ride. In the neighbourhood there are some nice restaurants and shops so everything you need is basically within walking distance. Our executive room was on the 4th (top floor). There were some quirky things about the room that were more boutique design than practical. For example, the bathroom didn't have sinks. Instead, the sinks were located in the room right next to the bathroom and room door. Although slightly inpractical, this didn't bother us too much. The bathroom was otherwise excellent with a luxurious jacuzzi bathtub with a TV and a spacious shower. The hotel being practically brand new, everything was sparkling clean and fresh. The room had a Nespresso machine and we enjoyed the chance to have a nice cup of coffee in the room. A nice touch was also the honesty bar in the downstairs lobby where you could help yourself to some drinks. The breakfast was fantastic, the buffet catered for every basic need and there was also Ã  la carte list for extras, such as delicious pancakes. We also ate one evening at the hotel, the food was quite basic but worth the price. One nice thing was also that tickets to the museums could be bought from the hotel, which saved us a quite a lot of time that would have been otherwise spent queuing outside the museums. The service was excellent and staff were always cheerful and happy to answer any questions we had. Overall, Hotel JL no76 is a nice luxury boutique hotel with great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel which has the wow factor and staff to match”
Reviews.Author: nadeemcrowe
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying in this hotel and yes... I have had some issues with my room but I have had my room swapped and I will take these issues up with the manager. However this was a matter of bad luck (sort of) and I don't want to take away from what a lovely hotel this is. First of all the area - well it is saying something when you walk out of the hotel and you can see the Louis Vuitton sign sparkling on the street adjacent. This is Amsterdam and its most upmarket with the most expensive shopping street in the city at your door. The street which is home to the hotel is on a small tree lined road parallel to the fashion district and is peaceful and pretty. When you arrive at the hotel it has that "boutique" feel you expect. Classy, kitsch and dressed with persian rugs and quirky contemporary art. In the reception is also the "honesty bar" - a not so mini mini bar for all guests to use, take what you want and write it down on a card which you then leave at reception to be billed for later. Now - the rooms. I stayed in the executive room. I walked in and my initially though was "wow." Now I am a 25 year old solo traveller but I have stayed in some nice hotels across europe but I think this is my favourite. Clean, cool grey on the walls, simple and functional storage with plenty of room and a grand double bed with coco-matt mattress which really has that "jump in" allure. And then what every boy loves - GADGETS. A jacuzzi bath, build in high definition TV at the foot of the tub so you can catch up on CNN while the bubbles ease your tired legs. A nespresso machine to begin your day with a shot of caffeine and the best bit is everything works. I have stayed in endless hotels with gadgets galore but you turn the TV on and are met with a snowstorm. There are several english channels to choose from and the picture is crystal clear both in the bathroom and the widescreen in the main bedroom. To finish this review I would like to commend the hotel staff. The service is no doubt excellent and this is always best tested when you have a complaint. The issues with my room were dealt with superbly - there is a lesson to be learnt from many hotels by the way I was death with today. It makes such a difference when someone shows some understanding when you explain you have had a rough night. This hotel is perfectly placed and perfectly appointed. It makes your trip feel special and I would thoroughly recommend you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “quiet location”
Reviews.Author: william7093
Reviews.Content: nespresso coffee maker in room very good , jacuzzi bath great for relax tv in bathroom , and big comfy bed , room was a little on small side but luxury makes up for that ,would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great place, great location!”
Reviews.Author: ajdSingapore
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights recently, very friendly staff, top location, nice building, tastefully decorated rooms and loved all te art in the hotel. Hotel is brand new and feels like home with the honesty bar concept. Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect elegant place to stay in the heart of culture and fashion district.”
Reviews.Author: Joslovestotravel
Reviews.Content: Living in Atlanta, USA and originally from Amsterdam; I decided to celebrate my birthday back in Amsterdam. With many of my fiends from US, Asia and Europe we all stayed in Hotel JL. First and foremost, the hotel is located in just a perfect spot, close to the Vondelpark (love my morning run), Amsterdam's version of Rodeo Drive is literally around the corner and the museums are around the other corner. Some of my friends being first timers to Amsterdam were absolutely falling in love with this neighborhood, also because it's less than 10 min walk to the Leidseplein and canal area. The hotel itself has a cool, contemporary elegance and feels very welcoming and relaxed. Some of my guests being frequent travelers said they would on their next visit to Amsterdam skip the big brand hotels and stay in Hotel JL. I personally think that the staff is really making all the difference in the world and one small example is: when we returned from a biking tour (on the hotel bikes) showing windmills, canals and all that: when we were parking all the bikes on our return at the hotel. The receptionist, her name was Cindy, came out with a tray of glasses with ice water for everyone. I was gobsmacked. A small gesture with a great impact. A throughout our stay the staff was making all guests feel at home. A great example of a boutique hotel with that sincere personal touch often difficult to find at the big brand hotels. Can't wait to come back to Amsterdam again!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Staff! Clean, modern and in a great Location”
Reviews.Author: adomino
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a sleepy part of the city near all the museums but close enough to the action if you want to see the city nightlife. The staff was amazing and the hotel was very clean and modern. The rooms were standard for Europe (small) but very well decorated. The bathroom was very cool and spacious. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cool design and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: 2WorldtravellersSYD
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the JL No76 for two nights and enjoyed our cozy room, the fresh yummy breakfast and the great location very much. The hotel is very well located - close to the museums, high end shopping and the beautiful Vondel Park. You can borrow bikes or even the hotels scooter / Vespa to explorer the city the Amsterdam way! We stayed in a room on the 4th floor with nice views on the tree lined street. The room was small but with great attention to details! We didn't use our jacuzzi and TV set in the bathroom, but liked the rainshower a lot! Beds are heavenly, its a layered mattress with cocoa gras and they are super comfy! Wireless is foc and so is the super friendly service. We also liked the "honesty" bar in the restaurant / lobby, were the guest can help themselves 24/7 with wine, drinks, coffees and refreshments. Definitely can recommend the hotel, value for money and a smile for free!

Reviews.Title: “Small boutique hotel in good location. Recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Mat0
Reviews.Content: This is a new, small boutique hotel close to the major museums (2 min walk to Van Gogh etc). It's in a quiet residential street, but still only steps away from the high end shoppingareas of Van Baerlestraate and P.J Hooftstraat. Trams 2 and 5 will take you to "down town" in only 5 minutes time (about 15 min to the central station) or you can walk to Leidseplein in about 7 minutes. I had a pleasant experience during my business trip. Good service from all staff members throughout the stay despite what others have experienced. The beds are actually some of the best hotelbeds I have ever slept in. I may have been upgraded as I reserved a standard room, but was surprised to see a jacuzzi with built-in TV in the bathroom(only in Executive rooms according to the website). My only critizism is that the mirror over the sink is put up way to high. I am avarage height, but could only see the upper half of my face while doing my make-up ... I know the Dutch are the tallest people in the world, but dont forget the rest of us : ) Had the breakfast one morning, and it had a more than sufficient variety of choices. It was possible to order pancakes, eggs of your choice etc. Did not try the restaurant or room service. I think this hotel deserves better than its current rating on Tripadvisor (Nr 242), but I believe this will get better as more guests rate this new hotel. I highly recommend it.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel JL No76
HotelInfo.Address: Jan Luijkenstraat 76, Amsterdam 1071 CT, The Netherlands
